alert.note: Alert for Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 5:05PM EDT until May 21 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Ohio, including the following counties, Hancock, Seneca and Wyandot. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 505 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Findlay, Tiffin, Fostoria, Upper Sandusky, Arlington, Bloomville, Sycamore, Arcadia, Vanlue, New Riegel, Marseilles, Carey, Bloomdale, Republic, Mount Blanchard, Wharton, Bairdstown, Kirby, Bascom and Williamstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
